notes: The Daleks first started using "exterminate" on a regular basis to refer to the killing of individuals.
This furthers their parallels with Nazism, established in their debut.
The Daleks go so far as to refer to the killings as a "final solution".
This was the first story to be produced at the new Riverside Studios, the production team having moved from Lime Grove Studios.
It also saw a quarry used for location filming for the first time.

During recording, as Richard McNeff (Baker) was carrying William Hartnell down the ramp of the Dalek flying saucer, the ramp suddenly collapsed. Hartnell fell on a metal camera stand, landing awkwardly on his spine. Although he was temporarily paralysed, he recovered sufficiently to continue the recording, but it was decided he should have the following week off to recover from the bruised back he had sustained.

continuity_notes: The Doctor and Susan's previous encounters with the Daleks are referenced, including that the Daleks have adapted a way around their reliance on static electricity for power.
The Seventh Doctor later returns to the scene where Susan dropped her TARDIS key to recover it.
The Third Doctor encounters an alternative timeline in which the Daleks had again successfully invaded Earth.
The Eleventh Doctor and River Song visited the events of the Dalek invasion while trying to shut down renegade time corridors.

plot.plot_summary: The TARDIS returns to London in the 22nd century, where the Daleks have invaded and taken over the city. The Doctor and his companions must work with the human resistance to stop the Daleks and prevent them from extracting the Earth's core. After a series of adventures and battles, the Daleks' plan is thwarted and the invasion is ended, but at the cost of Susan leaving the Doctor to stay behind with a human man she has fallen in love with.
